answer.explanation: Thanks for coming to this department head meeting. Today our focus is budgeting. Q1 Our new video game is coming along, but once again the release date s been pushed back. This means a lot of our resources will be tied up until this project is completed , but who knows when that will be. For now, Q2 we need to cut costs in other places So I’d like each of you to identify areas in your department where you can make budget cuts. Q3 I’m ready to set aside time to work with you individually to review your departmental budgets, Let me know when you have time to do this.

question.text: What does the speaker imply when she says, “Who knows when that will be”?
choices: (A) She does not understand a request.
(B) She needs employees to work faster.
(C) She is uncertain when a project will be completed.
(D) She wants to hear from the audience.

answer.text: (C) She is uncertain when a project will be completed.

question.text: What is the topic of the meeting?
What does the speaker say she will set aside time to do?

answer.explanation: Good evening listeners! Q1 Here’s your WXRN traffic report. For anyone traveling near the city center, there are twenty-to thirty-minute delays entering the city, and traffic is backed up on the highways. Q2 As you know, our city is hosting the regional baseball tournament this week. It begins this afternoon in the stadium, and attendance is expected to reach around ten thousand. So if you have to commute into the city this week, Q3 we strongly encourage you to take the bus or the train.

According to the speaker, what will begin today?

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
Q1 Hello, you’ve reached Susan and Clare’s Downtown Shop. Beginning this Tuesday, we are closed for three days in order to expand the display space. Q1&2 We will open this Friday with a much wider selection of women’s pants and sweaters. Q3 To celebrate our renovation, we will be offering 10% off all purchases on our first day back in business. Thank you for your interest.

What improvement is mentioned?

question.text: When can customers receive a discount?

answer.explanation: Q1 Good afternoon mall patrons. I’d like to direct your attention to the center court of our shopping mall today. In just fifteen minutes, we’re inviting you to join us there for a high energy "Fitness Meets Fashion" show. We’ll be showcasing a variety of looks for winter athletic apparel from different stores here in the mall. Q2 After the show, there'll be physical trainers on hand for those who have questions about winter gear and how to train outdoors during the cold weather. . And one of the clothing companies participating, Q3 Urban Olympiad, has just set up a new store on the ground floor. They’ve opened their doors for the first time today.

answer.explanation: Hi. It's Maria, and Q1 I’m calling with some information about the party that we’re organizing for Nadia’s retirement. Now, um… Q2 you and I decided that the party would be on August fifth. And, Km really glad to hear that forty people from the office are coming. But, unfortunately, it looks like we can’t use the coupon from Dinner Delights after all. We might want to make a reservation someplace else... Also, Marc agreed to play Nadia’s favorite song on his guitar during the party. Q3 Do you think you could make photocopies of the lyrics so that everyone can sing along?

question.text: Why is an event being held?
Look at the graphic. Why is the speaker unable to use the coupon for the event?
choices: (A) There are not enough people in the group.
(B) The length of the event is too long.
(C) All of the locations in the area are booked.
(D) The event will take place after the expiration date.

answer.text: (D) The event will take place after the expiration date.

question.text: What does the speaker ask the listener to do?

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
Every winter, families waste hundreds of dollars paying unreasonable prices to heat their homes. Q1&2 By installing Garcia MX insulated windows in your home, you can add an extra layer of protection against dust and noise as well as lower your monthly heating costs. Q3 You can get 20 percent off installation costs this month just by mentioning this radio advertisement when you call. So why wait? Call today at 555-7263!

What is mentioned about the product?
choices: (B) It reduces the cost of living.

answer.text: (B) It reduces the cost of living.

choices: (A) Buy a certain amount of products

answer.explanation: Hello, Q1 I’m calling about a problem I had with your bus service. I ride the six o’clock bus home from work. Q2 Yesterday evening I waited for the bus for an hour in the rain before giving up and taking a taxi. I checked your company's Web site for news about delays but there wasn't any current information posted, so I decided to call this information hotline. Q3 Can you tell me if there’s been a change to the bus schedule? I need to know today please, before my work day ends. My phone number is 555-0127. Thanks.

question.text: What business is the speaker calling?
Why did the speaker take a taxi?
choices: (D)  She was late for a party.

choices: (B) How much a repair will cost
(C) How to get to an event

Q1 This is the end of today’s product demonstration for our newest model of cell phone. If you would like to become a beta tester for this cell phone, please wait and talk to our representative, James Goldman. Q2 Volunteers must have worked in the consumer electronics industry for at least 5 years. Q3 Remember, during the beta trial period, volunteers are strictly forbidden to release any details about the product. Thank you very much for your interest in our brand-new model. I hope you enjoyed the presentation.

answer.explanation: First, some great news to start the meeting - Q1 thanks to this team’s excellent product designs, our tine of Ruby Star appliances outsold all competing appliances on the market last quarter. Well done! Now I want to discuss our revised product development process. Q2 As you can see from this flowchart, we’ve added a step between "create a design" and "build a model". This new step means you’ll need approval from the executive board before creating your prototype. Lately, Q3 there’s been some concern about the amount off time being spent on prototypes that never actually become products. This new process will help our team become more productive and use time more efficiently.

question.text: What does the speaker say about the company's Ruby Star appliances?
choices: (C) They cost less than competing products.
(D) They were reviewed in a trade magazine.

question.text: Look at the graphic. According to the speaker, which step was recently added?
What concern does the speaker mention?
choices: (A) Manufacturing materials are in short supply.
(C) Employees’ time has been used inefficiently.
(D) A production deadline has been changed.

answer.text: (C) Employees’ time has been used inefficiently.

answer.explanation: Q1 I’d like to start our weekly personnel department meeting with a hiring update for the Dubai office. As you know, we’ve been working hard to fill several managerial positions there by the beginning of summer. Q2 So far, we haven’t received any applications from qualified candidates outside the company, and well, the deadline to submit was May 15. Q3 So, since several current employees have applied, I want the team to start interviewing them next week. Please be on the lookout for the interview schedule, which I'll e-mail you shortly.

question.text: Who most likely is the speaker?
What does the speaker mean when she says, "the deadline to submit was May 15”?
choices: (A) She missed a good job opportunity.
(B) She needs to verify some details.
(C) She must move forward with a task.
(D) She forgot to notify a colleague.

answer.text: (C) She must move forward with a task.
